intro: Phyteuma repandum, commonly known as the common phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing violet-blue or white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and woodland edges. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
